columns.text: In this problem, we will prepare the balance sheet for the company that contains the common size and common base.

A common-size balance sheet is a type of balance sheet that shows the relative percentage of the assets. On the other hand, the common-base balance sheet is a type of balance sheet that shows the relationship of the current year account value and the base year account value.

To get the common-size, we will simply take the amounts in 2018 and divide it individually by the total liabilities and owners' equity for that Year. The resulting sheet will look like this:

[![Screen-Shot-2022-04-24-at-19-00-57.png](https://i.postimg.cc/NFW25Tv4/Screen-Shot-2022-04-24-at-19-00-57.png)](https://postimg.cc/gLH27xJX)

For the common-base, we will first take the common-size percentage for the previous year by taking the values and dividing it by the total liabilities and owners' equity. The sheet will look like this:

[![Screen-Shot-2022-04-24-at-19-13-56.png](https://i.postimg.cc/9MPqrzQ5/Screen-Shot-2022-04-24-at-19-13-56.png)](https://postimg.cc/0MQN4kSc)

Finally, for the common-base percentage, we will take the common-size percentage for 2018 then divide it by the percentage in 2017. The sheets will then look like this:

[![Screen-Shot-2022-04-24-at-19-18-40.png](https://i.postimg.cc/kG0rzMWG/Screen-Shot-2022-04-24-at-19-18-40.png)](https://postimg.cc/PvQF8j3n)
